Articles.Content:
I got a bit curious about the Whale music when we are in space.

I really like that music, even tho it is a little weird to listen to whale sounds in space, but somehow it adds to the atmosphere of the game.

Who composed that music? That music reminds me of lots of things, like Frontier Elite 2, somehow, and X2 the threat, and it reminds me of the Album "global communication" .

I want to explore the work of the composer who made that music because i really find it relaxing xD
It comes from here I think. I don't know exactly what it is.

It comes from here I think. I don't know exactly what it is.

look up Kevin MacLeod at the adress, but i'm not even sure which ones has the whales.
That is not Incompetech music; it was composed by someone at Squad. I'm not certain who, but the credits list Victor Machado as the game's composer, so that's who I went with when I uploaded that.

sounds like you need to time travel and save the whales!! .....and kerbility

you win an internet if you got the refrence
Well I would, but as it turns out, doing a slingshot maneuver around the sun doesn't send you back to 1986 no matter how fast you're going when you do it.
As I understand it, the whale sounds won out over baboon sounds. *Just kidding!*

sounds like you need to time travel and save the whales!! .....and kerbility

you win an internet if you got the refrence

I got it. Great, I'll add it to my other Internets...

Well, I have to say when I heard the whales I found it totally appropriate. I found other weird music streams on the Internet such as A-A Ambient (music from outer space) that is very relaxing.

Interesting, the http://longplayer.org/ song is made with tibetan singing bowls. The song length is 1000 years; made with non-repeating 20 minutes segments. It was been playing for 13 years and it will be streaming until 2999.

you win an internet if you got the refrence

If you don't get that reference, you possibly need to see more films that came from major tv sci-fi franchises.

If you don't get that reference, you possibly need to see more films that came from major tv sci-fi franchises.

anyone who doesn't know that this is from "Lost in Space" is ridiculous.

Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home

That's what my mind tells me about whale sounds in space xD
It makes me want to crash into the Sun, for some reason...
